title: 103_s651
content: The policy of the United States Government is to ensure that historically Black colleges and universities, as well as nonprofit organizations owned and controlled by Black Americans, have equal participation in federally funded research and development activities. The purpose of this Act is to increase the involvement of these institutions in research and development by designating them as federally funded research and development centers. The United States Government aims to ensure equal participation of historically Black colleges and universities and nonprofit organizations owned and controlled by Black Americans in research and development activities. The Federal Acquisition Regulation mandates equitable participation of historically Black colleges and universities and nonprofit organizations owned by Black Americans in research and development activities for executive agencies. Agencies must designate at least 5 such institutions as research centers and reserve 3% of funds for technical assistance. The Federal Acquisition Regulation requires equitable participation of historically Black colleges and universities and nonprofit organizations owned by Black Americans in federally funded research and development activities. Agencies must designate at least 5 institutions as research centers and reserve a percentage of funds for technical assistance. In fiscal year 1997, 15% of agency funds must be allocated to research and development, increasing to 20% in fiscal year 1998 and beyond. Federally funded research centers must assess technical assistance needs and implement a coordinated delivery plan. The Administrator can authorize agencies to designate fewer than 5 historically Black colleges and universities for participation. The Administrator can designate fewer than 5 historically Black colleges and universities or nonprofit organizations as federally funded research and development centers if funds are insufficient. The head of an agency must consider these centers as responsible sources for research contracts. Unused funds for research and development activities in a fiscal year can be carried over. The subsection (a)(2)(C) allows for support of research and development activities at federally funded research and development centers. Any unspent amounts must be returned to the Treasury. The term 'historically Black college and university' is defined in section 322(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965. Additionally, the Comptroller General of the United States is required to conduct an annual study on executive agencies' activities related to this section. The Comptroller General of the United States will conduct a study on executive agencies' compliance with procurement policy requirements and provide technical assistance. The first report is due in 1995. The amendments made by section 3 will be effective on October 1, 1994.
